title: If your champion pool looks a little like this and your stuck in low elo please do yourself a favour
body:
{{champion:67}} {{champion:157}} {{champion:7}} {{champion:64}} {{champion:107}} {{champion:92}} {{champion:112}} {{champion:238}} 

and stop playing them, their skill cap is too high for you. if your stuck in silver but have 200 games on any of these champions then you truely don't know how to play them else you wouldnt be stuck in your current elo.

If you have a negative win rate or negative kd with over 20 games on any of the above champions. the champion is simply just not for you.

take this from me i've abandoned multiple champions because I don't believe i'm good with them (i've stopped playing gangplank, olaf, jayce, quinn and yorick because i've preformed poorly on them)

(its just stating the obvious)

replies.body:
I personally just play champions that i like.
I don't care how far they get me in ranked.

{{champion:268}} {{champion:136}} {{champion:163}} 

Those 3 are perfect for me, i like their lore, their looks, their personality, and their play style, and ill play them wether i get bronze 5 or diamond 1.


I guess its subjective, if you get most of your fun out of winning, then maybe its fine to stop playing champs that you aren't good with, but if just playing cool characters gives you fun, then i see no reason why people should give up playing champs they like, even if they don't do well in ranked.

> I guess its subjective, if you get most of your fun out of winning, then maybe its fine to stop playing champs that you aren't good with, but if just playing cool characters gives you fun, then i see no reason why people should give up playing champs they like, even if they don't do well in ranked.

the thing, in ranked, you want to perform your best, and if you arent mechanically capable of playing those champs then realistically you shouldn't be, playing for fun is what norms are for, thats the "casual" game mode.

I love azir's lore as well. 

Tbh people always talk about how riven is one of the highest skillcap champions in the game but when I see a silver riven, they can generally still winlane but I see a silver azir, I know that lane is screwed unless by some miracle it's a smurf, in which case they will singlehandedly win the game.

Compared to any other champion I feel the base level of skill required to play azir is probably the highest in the game. With riven or leesin or yasou, so long as you don't try anything too ambitious if you have a bit of experience you won't do that badly but I've seen silver azirs with over 200k mastery point and their entire azir match history will be negative.

Well to me i don't see the point of climbing if you can only climb with easy champs.

Being gold 5 with Azir would mean more to me than reaching platinum 1 by only playing Garen.
"Performing your best" as you say, isn't "your best" if you can only achieve it by using easy champs.

I like certain champions, if I'm not good enough to get high ranked by using these champions... then i don't deserve it.

Analogy:
Two people make $5 million a year. One person runs a chain of computer stores. The other person tried to have a chain of computer stores, but failed, and now smuggles drugs and sells them on the street.

Both achieve the same "rank" and earn the $5 million, but one takes the easy route and one takes the hard route. 
Who has the greater skill?

i dunno i had like a 80%win rate on zed and leblanc in season 6 and i was silver 5

That's good. I think the OP is meaning those guys that have like 200 games on one of those champions with a less than 45% winrate and KDA of less than 2:1. Like the definition of insanity..playing the same champion again and expecting different results.

Funnily enough, it probably has nothing to do with which champion that they are playing why their results are not good, and they need to learn some gameplay strategy to actually carry with those champions. Nothing worse than a Yasuo with godlike mechanics and a monkey brain at strategy that goes 15-10-10 in game and then blames their team for being noobs.
